comments.commentBody: Trump is a known and well established liar -- from the contractors that he has stiffed over the years, the Trump University students that he scammed, the business partners who were cheated during bankruptcy, and the banks who refused to lend him money. Why should we expect him to change now?
The Department of Justice doesn't needs pixies. Actually, he resembles an ancient puppet. Until of course, he speaks.

@socrates may I add, so what if the president of divided states of America brags how smart he is that he doesn't pay his taxes?

Only stupid people pay taxes.

This is like Nixon all over again. If the president does it it is NOT illegal.
If we can overcome the gerrymandering and voter supression first.

Enough of the euphemisms for it. "Mis-speak", "alternative facts" and, as Churchill called them, "terminological inexactitudes" are lies.  We teach our children that before kindergarten.  And we teach our children something else too, that these people never learned:  It is wrong.
Richard19--I'm not so certain that millions of Americans won't be fooled again.  They have been trained to respond exactly the way that they do.

Ms. Collins, needing a splash of vodka in her martini, keeps the Russian ruse alive with a session about Sessions. Recusing himself without reason keeps the pitchforks waving and shouts off with his head. Meanwhile, Madame Pelosi and Chuckie Schumer protest with green eyed envy wondering why they have been snubbed from dining on caviar with Ambassador Sergey Kislyak.

Feeling belittled, their frowns are turned upside down with fangs exposed during another soft media frenzy. However, they also hover in fear and hiding, hoping one of their own, the truth-challenged Senator Claire McCaskill, herself a Russian meet and greeter, but denied will be able to fly under the radar as her election comes not too soon enough for circling red sharks.

In this topsy-turvy, credibility challenged world when did Russia become too right for the left?

Difficult to know why the republicans wouldn't want a thorough, open investigation of the entire so-called Trump-Russia affair, if only to clear the air in an atmosphere of denial that muddles every aspect of policy making in Washington. The more obfuscation, the more suspicion. The more suspicion, the more lack of trust. It seems such a simple, basic rule: tell the truth. Take responsibility for your actions. If those actions are worthy, there is no reason to hide. If not, the worthy thing to do is admit it and be courageous about facing the consequences.
Charles, you propose a simple and ethical solution for Trump & Co.  It's an ironic suggestion given the conniving and deceitful 'deal makers' that have been at this game for a long, long time.
No one disagrees - but Russia successfully distabilised us in 2016.
Perhaps the Administration should just have a Russian State of Union Speech and inform us why we should appreciate Vladimir and the Kremlin as much as they do?

Christiana, please get your facts straight about the uranium sale if you are at all interested in facts at all. Clinton was one of 9 cabinet members and department heads that sat on the CFIUS with the Sec of Treasury as chairperson. The job of the board was to evaluate the sale then turn the findings to the President. The then Assistant Sec of State Fernandez represented the State Dept on the board  and said Clinton never intervened in committee matters. You are listening to alternative facts which are lies unless you think that Clinton twisted the arms of the 8 other members and the President to get the sale done, so wrong!
I predict the GoFundMe account for the hacker's legal defense fund would top $500 million within a week.

It is incredible. The press would probably get more honest answers is they questioned Tass or Pravada then the Russian agent in the WH, Trump.

This breach of security is probably our greatest threat since the USSR stole our Manhattan Project secrets.

Republicans in Congress...when are you gonna do your job and protect national security??
Thank you, James. You bring a refreshing air to this "Russian problem".

Will people still support school vouchers if they are used to send students to Muslim madrassas? DeVos is against standards for these private schools. What if such a school only requires memorizing the Bible or Quran?

Scandinavian schools and students are the best in the world. When asked about the reason for their success everyone said it's because they have only public schools and they are funded equally by federal taxes. There are no poor schools because they do not derive their money from property taxes so that even schools in poorer communities get the same excellent education as schools in richer districts. Oh, and they pay their teachers well and treat them with the respect that they deserve.

Clearly, DeVos and Trump have no knowledge, experience, or  expertise in education. They do have knowledge, experience, and expertise in siphoning off tax dollars into their own pockets.   And yes, DeVos has her personal agenda to allow creationism to be taught as if it is a valid scientific explanation of how the earth became what it has become.  It is unlikely that she or Trump have any real knowledge of what evolution is or why it is considered to be proven concept at this time, with a a great deal of evidence to show why that is the case.

Excellent points!!  Mary, apparently voucher proponents will overlook WHICH faith benefits as long as they are perpetuating their privatization agenda,  NC has put their charter/voucher takeover on the fast track.  Currently $44 million is diverted from public money to the voucher program (they call them "Opportunity Scholarships" ...wink, wink) but our rabid legislature has ensured that by 2027 funding will reach $144 million.  In one of the first years funds were dispersed, the biggest single windfall, $650,000, if I remember correctly, went to a strictly Muslim school.  The school is located in a community-wide Muslim center and its "curriculum", according to its poorly updated website, includes direct instruction of the Quran.  I had to do a bit of research to discover this, so It's probably a safe bet that the general public has no idea that this is where their taxes dollars are going.   In the interest of fairness, it's also probably a safe bet that Christian schools (which make up about 90% of the voucher recipients in NC) are providing direct instruction in the Bible.  While they probably cringe when handing over money to a Muslim school, they are not stupid enough to deny funding to a particular faith for fear that potential discrimination lawsuits would blow their scam wide open and the public might learn what really goes on.  All it really does is REsegregate schools and drain funding from public ed, ensuring that it WILL "fail" and justify MORE privatization.

Denmark has private schools in addition to the public schools.  I know, I used to pay the tuition for my child to attend one.  That isn't to say that the public schools aren't very good there, they are.  But let's deal with facts.  As far as Steve Yarbrough is concerned, he is a leech -- the Arizona legislature is loaded with them.  They hate government except when they can make money off of it.

You call it "strong" to destroy democracy in America, Mr. Scott? You call it strong to pass laws that try to stop peaceful protests? You call it strong to undo regulations that protect OUR environment? You call it strong to break unions - except the police and firefighter unions that you need to protect YOU? You call it strong to attack women's rights to make their own choices about fetus-bearing and living their lives?

You call it strong to be a puppet operative for BIG democracy-destroying money masters who are busy engineering another stock market crash so they can transfer even more of OUR wealth and national resources into their pockets? You call it strong to cheat any way you can to get "votes" and suppress the votes of millions of America? You call it strong to lie every time you open your mouth?

I call it fascism. Your supposed "strength" has no place in OUR America. Your days are numbered as supposed "governor". WOMEN are going to make sure of it.

yes, Trump is the rotten "head" and master of distraction. with" Session's met Russian" hot in the news, Trump tweeted that Obama administration "bugged " Trump Tower in October. oh, did he just find out now? how did these bugs installed in his "kingdom" without his people knowing/ or colluding ? have they been removed since he was elected ? why would Obama people removed them voluntarily ? wouldn't that keep on producing "juicy " stuff about Trump and his cohorts ?

this administration is taking our country down the drain into NEW cesspool.

Kislyak was known as Russia's top spy in this country well before the campaign season even started. So, why was he being so heavily courted by Trump's minions?
Clearly both the Russians and the Trump administration have agendas in place. The Russian one should well be obvious. The Trump plan? That, like virtually all of his other "plans" needs a lot of explanation.

Wasn't it the Republicans who criticized Hillary for the private server because if you or I had violated a company policy, we would be fired?  Where are these same critics now?  I certainly know that lying on one's application or in an interview are grounds for termination in any job.  I pick option "A", Gail.
"What we've got here is failure to communicate."
A) Telling lies should not be a job requirement for AG.
Trump is loyal to Trump. Just ask Gingrich, Giuliani, and Christie.

At first, I was starting to believe that this was that old joke, often modified to meet the circumstances: How many Trumpians does it take to receive instructions from Vliaddie; but, now I see that, with all of the coaching by Sergey Kislyak, the Trump Circus has its own version of the famous inter-nested Trampolines?

And, aren't they cute? Well, they might be, IF they weren't so busy doing-in America! Meanwhile, Putie and Sergey are just sitting back, and smiling.

And, toasting a vodka: Mission Accomplished!

https://thetruthoncommonsense.com

As in the Dukes of Hazzard--"Just a good ole boy...Never meanin' no harm...beats all you ever saw, been in trouble with the law since the day he was born..." A well-liked pixie, indeed, but with evil intent. As the law says, one must have INTENT in order to break the law. And now, he says he will revise his testimony, in writing, not in person, on Monday, so that he won't "misspeak" again. If it's in writing, those pesky Democrats can't ask questions that might trip him up. Sally Yates's replacement, Dana Boente, will now be in charge of the Russian-connection investigation, and, Trump and Session believe, all is right with the world.

I lived through LBJ and Nixon. At least those two knew how a bill became a law. Trump makes Nixon look like a boy scout (no offense meant to boy scouts!). The Watergate break-in is child's play when compared to what this guy has done in six weeks. What has this country become, when constant lying, cheating and revenge have become the norm? When even Nixon's environmental record is being destroyed? I learned in elementary school (when Eisenhower was president) that it was not only my right but my responsibility to speak out when the president and other government officials were wrong. And when we speak out, Trump says we're paid protestors? I, for one, am waiting for my $1,500 form whatever source. I'm retired and could use the money.

Based on the recent election every GOP and Dem ( I am talking to you Joe manchin) elected official that has supported DJT and not publicly denounced him and ALL of his appointees is in their final term in office! Period.

What the GOP lead government is doing is unconscionable and they count on voters who go along and do not rise up. That is now over!

Anyone aligned with DJT must be voted out or removed from office.

There are recent election that show the momentum tipping away from the GOP. Until the 2018 midterms demand full investigations of Trussia and his tax returns.
